Html:
I am migrating the app from Windows Phone 7.0 to 7.1.

Is there a version available to support Windows Phone Developer Tools SDK (for development with the Windows Phone 7.1 )?

We have updated the Windows Phone 7 Prism library to Mango.  However, at this time, we are publishing this code here: http://wp7guide.codeplex.com/ on Friday afternoon.  In 3-6 weeks we will publish a new signed library for Prism that includes the Mango fixes.

For now, please download Drop 1 here: http://wp7guide.codeplex.com/ on Friday, extract the zip file and copy the Prism library code to your project and build it.

Have a great day,

Karl

Karl,

I recently know that you moved to p&p .. :) 

Do you guys rewrite it for wp7? Did you remove Unity as well?

Since the early day of wp7, I had a email conversation with Chris regarding Unity. I wanted to port it but the problem is that Compact framework never has Reflection.Emit and the latest version of Unity uses it a lot.. I was thinking to use the old version with Reflection based Object Builder but bad performance.

We have done some investigation to have Unity for WP7 but for the same reasons you have mentioned, are not moving ahead with this.  Currently we use Funq for our p & p projects on the WP7.

Cheers,

Karl

satya:  We removed BindingListener since, as of Mango, binding was supported correctly in behaviors.  If you still find you need BindingListener, you can take it from the old code base, but you may find that you no longer need it if you were using it for scenarios similar to ours.
